resources.string:
This is the about page.
 
The current state of this app is a usable image classifier, for offline, in the field. 

 
This app can be used to identify 21 taxa of benthic (freshwater/river) macroinvertebrates,.
 
The report functionality generates PDFs for Licking County's Stream Team or the Ohio Historic River's Stream Quality Monitoring (SQM) programs. Contact the developer if you would like to add compatibility with your program.
 
Developed by Maxwell Budd.

 

This app uses the following Open-source libraries:
 - Joda-time
 - tensorflow-litej
 - PDFBox

The offline macroinvertebrate classifier included in this version of the app reaches (???)% accuracy on images it has never seen. Trust your judgement and double-check with the binary search tool (ICON).
No generic beetle larvae category is classified with the image search function (the three-group macroinvertebrate tally asks about generic beetles).

More Resources (not associated with this app):

 https://macroinvertebrates.org: online high-res image set with explanations and guides to practice identifying macroinvertebrates yourself.
 https://iNaturalist.org: upload images and location to contribute to online nature tracking community effort. Others can help you identify. App also available from inaturalist.org.
 https://LifeInFreshWater.net: more information on each taxon.
